alert.note: Alert for Addison; Chittenden; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Vermont and northwest Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Addison and Washington. In northwest Vermont, Chittenden. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen near and just north of Bristol with recent rain gages reporting over 2 inches in the Jerusalem area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bristol, Starksboro, Lincoln, Buels Gore, Monkton, New Haven, Fayston, Warren, South Starksboro, West Lincoln and Jerusalem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
